result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S. Eichsteadt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric S. Eichsteadt

10:50 pm case called. Defendant Eric S. Eichsteadt in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader states the defendant has complied with terms of the agreement and requests costs. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA surcharge but no sample to be provided. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Case Called @ 1:34 PM: Defendant Eric S. Eichsteadt in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD requests add'l setencing date to allow for completion of programming.  DA would not oppose additional time for completion.  SEH adjourned - NOH Given.  Def reminded that terms of bond continue during pendency.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 07-06-2016 01:30 pm

Case called @ 2:03 p.m. Defendant Eric S. Eichsteadt in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by ADA Anderson. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred Sentencing Agreement which include no confrontational contact with D. Amsden, DE must complete an Anger Managment Program and the defendant is prohibited from commiting any criminal offenses during the period of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of Deferred Sentencing Agreement.  Matter stayed for 6 months. The Court reminds the defendant that the bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement. The court will allow the defendant to appear by phone at the SEH hearing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
